assignments.name: HW0: General Principles
assignments.description: In-class assignment covering Chapter 1: General Principles.

assignments.name: HW1: Force Vectors
assignments.description: Homework covering Chapters 2.1-2.4: Scalars and Vectors, Vector Operations, Vector Addition of Forces, Addition of Coplanar Forces. Problems: 2-1, 2-6, 2-10, 2-15, 2-24, 2-28, 2-33, 2-37, 2-52, 2-54, 2-55, 2-59.

assignments.name: HW2: Cartesian and Position Vectors
assignments.description: Homework covering Chapters 2.5-2.9: Cartesian Vectors, Addition of Cartesian Vectors, Position Vectors, Line Force Vectors, Dot Product. Problems: 2-63, 2-65, 2-67, 2-69, 2-74, 2-80, 2-88, 2-92, 2-97, 2-105, 2-119, 2-120.

assignments.name: HW3: Equilibrium of a Particle
assignments.description: Homework covering Chapters 3.1-3.4: Equilibrium of Particle, FBD of Particle, Coplanar Forces, 3-D Force. Problems: 3-3, 3-6, 3-11, 3-12, 3-27, 3-28, 3-40, 3-46, 3-47, 3-57, 3-62, 3-64.

assignments.name: HW4: Force System Resultants (Moments)
assignments.description: Homework covering Chapters 4.1-4.5: Scalar Moments, Principle of Moments, Cross Product, Vector Moments About a Point-3D, Vector Moments About an Axis-3D. Problems: 4-1, 4-5, 4-12, 4-29, 4-39, 4-47, 4-48, 4-53, 4-55, 4-60, 4-68, 4-70.

assignments.name: HW5: Force System Resultants (Couples)
assignments.description: Homework covering Chapters 4.6-4.7: Moment of a Couple, Simplify Force and Couple - Force and Moment. Problems: 4-82, 4-88, 4-96, 4-106, 4-109, 4-117, 4-122, 4-132, 4-139, 4-144, 4-154, 4-160.

assignments.name: HW6: Equilibrium of a Rigid Body
assignments.description: Homework covering Chapters 5.1-5.7: Equilibrium of Rigid Body, FBD of Rigid Body, Equations of Equilibrium, 2 and 3 Force Members. Problems: 5-11, 5-12, 5-13, 5-15, 5-23, 5-37, 5-41, 5-68, 5-71, 5-72, 5-78, 5-85.

assignments.name: HW7: Trusses
assignments.description: Homework covering Chapters 6.1-6.3: Trusses, Method of Joints (MOJ), Zero Force Members. Problems: 6-2, 6-4, 6-8, 6-17, 6-19, 6-20, 6-28, 6-32, 6-34, 6-36, 6-42, 6-49.

assignments.name: HW8: Frames and Machines
assignments.description: Homework covering Chapter 6.6: Frames and Machines. Problems: 6-66, 6-70, 6-72, 6-76, 6-78, 6-81, 6-83, 6-84, 6-99, 6-102, 6-108.

assignments.name: HW9: Internal Loadings
assignments.description: Homework covering Chapters 7.1-7.3: Internal Loadings, Shear and Moment Diagrams, Distributed Loading. Problems: 7-1, 7-7, 7-9, 7-11, 7-51, 7-53, 7-59, 7-81, 7-84, 7-88, 7-92, 7-93.

assignments.name: HW10: Friction
assignments.description: Homework covering Chapters 8.1-8.5: Dry Friction, Wedges, Screws, Belts. Problems: 8-1, 8-3, 8-26, 8-32, 8-42, 8-46, 8-50, 8-63, 8-86, 8-100.

assignments.name: HW11: Center of Gravity and Moment of Inertia
assignments.description: Homework covering Chapters 9.1-9.2, 10.1-10.2: CG, CM, and Centroids, Composite Bodies, Moment of Inertia, Parallel-Axis Theorem. Problems: 9-9, 9-11, 9-27, 9-61, 9-66, 9-67, 10-2, 10-29, 10-32, 10-35, 10-45, 10-52.

assignments.name: Group Project
assignments.description: A group project is due on the Friday of finals week. Further details will be provided in class.

exams.name: Midterm #1
exams.description: Covers material from Weeks 1-3 (Chapters 1-3). The exam will be held during the second class meeting of Week 4.

exams.name: Midterm #2
exams.description: Covers material from Weeks 5-7 (Chapters 4-5). The exam will be held during the second class meeting of Week 8.

exams.name: Midterm #3
exams.description: Covers material from Weeks 9-10 (Chapter 6). The exam will be held during the second class meeting of Week 11.

exams.name: Final Exam
exams.description: Comprehensive final exam. Location: Room 61-2311. Time: 7:30 pm to 10:00 pm.

lectures.name: Week 1: Introduction to Statics
lectures.description: L1: Chapter 1 - General Principles. L2: Chapters 2.1-2.4 - Scalars and Vectors, Vector Operations, Vector Addition of Forces, Addition of Coplanar Forces.

lectures.name: Week 2: Force Vectors
lectures.description: Holiday. L3: Chapters 2.5-2.9 - Cartesian Vectors, Addition of Cartesian Vectors, Position Vectors, Line Force Vectors, Dot Product.

lectures.name: Week 3: Equilibrium of a Particle
lectures.description: L4: Chapters 3.1-3.2 - Equilibrium of Particle, FBD of Particle. L5: Chapters 3.3-3.4 - Coplanar Forces, 3-D Force.

lectures.name: Week 5: Force System Resultants I
lectures.description: L7: Chapters 4.1-4.2 - Scalar Moments, Principle of Moments. L8: Chapters 4.3-4.5 - Cross Product, Vector Moments About a Point-3D, Vector Moments About an Axis-3D.

lectures.name: Week 6: Force System Resultants II
lectures.description: L9: Chapters 4.6-4.7 - Moment of a Couple, Simplify Force and Couple - Force and Moment.

lectures.name: Week 7: Equilibrium of a Rigid Body
lectures.description: L10: Chapters 4.8-4.9 - Further Simplification and Distributed Loading. L11: Chapters 5.1-5.3 - Equilibrium and FBD of Rigid Body. L12: Chapters 5.4-5.7 - 2/3 Force Members, Constraints.

lectures.name: Week 9: Structural Analysis - Trusses
lectures.description: L13: Chapters 6.1-6.3 - Trusses, Method of Joints (MOJ), Zero Force Members.

lectures.name: Week 10: Structural Analysis - Frames and Machines
lectures.description: L14: Chapter 6.4 - Method of Sections (MOS). L15-L16: Chapter 6.6 - Frames and Machines.

lectures.name: Week 11: Midterm Review and Exam
lectures.description: Midterm Review, Project Introduction, and Midterm #3.

lectures.name: Week 12: Internal Forces
lectures.description: L17a: Chapter 7.1 - Internal Loadings. L17b: Chapters 7.2-7.3 - Shear and Moment Diagrams, Distributed Loading.

lectures.name: Week 13: Friction
lectures.description: L18: Chapters 8.1-8.2 - Dry Friction. L19: Chapters 8.3-8.5 - Wedges, Screws, Belts.

lectures.name: Week 15: Center of Gravity and Moment of Inertia
lectures.description: L20: Chapters 9.1-9.2 - CG, CM, Centroids, Composite Bodies. L21: Chapters 10.1-10.2 - Moment of Inertia, Parallel-Axis Theorem.

lectures.name: Week 16: Final Exam
lectures.description: Chapter 10.4 - Moment of Inertia for Composite Areas. Final Exam is on Monday, Dec 9th.

course_details.website: Log into Mt. SAC portal (http://inside.mtsac.edu) and click the 'sign on to Mt. SAC Canvas' link in the eLearning Resources tab.

contact_information.office_hours: 6:30 pm MW before class and 8:25 MW after class

course_expectations: Access Canvas daily for information, notes, and assignments for this course.
Attend and participate in class by asking questions, answering questions, collaborating appropriately in all project and problem-solving activities.
Take course notes, read, and view supplemental materials before class and after class.
Complete all assignments and submit them by the due date.
Get together with other students and come to office hours to clarify what is not clear and to work on additional problems.
Complete your work on exams, homework, supplemental problems, and projects neatly and clearly.
Master understanding the material in this class.

required_materials.textbook: Engineering Mechanics: Statics, by R.C. Hibbeler, 15th ed.
required_materials.supplies: Standard note-taking supplies, a scientific calculator that is NCEES/SAT/ACT approved (e.g., TI-36, TI-84), a straight-edge. Quad rule pad (graph paper) for completing homework is highly recommended.

important_dates.event: Last Day to Drop Without a 'W'
Last Day to Drop With a 'W'
Last Day to Drop for No-Show
